message: If you open up a topic, it really depends on how popular a topic is at that moment
If it's popular, then you'll get a chatroom effect (nice!)
Otherwise, it's more like looking at a dead forumtopic
I think something should be done to push the chatroom effect through
Is it me, or is Convore starting to look like forum software?

Perhaps, redesigning the chatline display with the username bolded before the message, and the timestamp at the right [at the moment, it resembles Twitter statuses too much, giving it a less real time feel]
nice idea, i've already switched to a more chat-like ui in my console client for convore
[Like I posted this message X minutes ago, and now I'm already gone...]
Yeah, more chat-like. I think absolute timestamps (without date) would be perfect
Example:
*Rygu*: This is an example. It should invite people to join in the convo.                            14:28
absolute timestamps mean they have to deal with timezones.
I got as far as getting a readout of which groups I belong to and any unread topics in there.
I'd really like to make a simple bot framework for it. Each topic in a goroutine, communicating back when it gets a message.
nice. i was about to write my tool in go, but then decided to use a familiar language (python) in order to attract more potential contributors
Not sure how well that would scale, but should be interesting.
@justinlilly i see you've created a go language group in convore. it's still empty :(
not bad. I wrote a little script last night / this morning which consumes some of the API via Go.
I'm just learning it, but it seems neat.
this is how this chat look like in the convoread tool http://codepad.org/D51yzbw5
I only meant twitter extracts the 'status' from facebook, like the top part of a muffin.
toss away the soft part of the muffin, and you still got a tasty snack
yep, i'm a little bit sad about python's support for concurrency ;( there is no established actor library for it
I just created it last night. Haven't had much to put into it.
oh you don't need to delete your feedback! :D
Isn't convore to forums like twitter is to facebook?
Meaning more active, less passive?
@vlasovskikh are you talking about this? -> https://convore.com/feedback/convoread-simple-console-client-for-convore/
@itsnotvalid yes
@vlasovskikh now can shell out on iPhone, a proper client already ;-)
